text.title: DRILLING BEGINS
text.body: Scientists began drilling GISP2 at the thickest part of the Greenland Ice Sheet in June 1989. Data end at the layer of snow laid down the previous winter. Drilling ended in 1993. The station has since expanded and is now an observatory used for studying climate change, Earth systems and astrophysics.
text.description: The GISP2 drill site, also known as Summit Station, sits  3.2 kilometers (two miles) above sea level.
